results.title: All's well in Rothenburg
results.creator_credit: Brainard Miller and Point Lobos Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a look at the city of Rothenburg today (1978), as well as considering some aspects of its colourful history.

results.title: All I desire [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Seasoned stage actress, Naomi Murdoch (Barbara Stanwyck), receives a letter from her long lost daughter, Lily (Lori Nelson), inviting her to come and see her star in a local production. After years in the big city, Naomi impulsively decides to return to the small-town where she once lived. Despite the good intentions, Naomi’s return disrupts the small-town life, provoking a myriad of reactions from each family member - from delight to despair - and re-igniting an old flame with a shady character. “All I desire” turns on the divide between city/small-town, female independence/domesticity, recklessness/conformity, with each character embodying either side. The only one torn between the two is Naomi who yearns deeply for the love of her husband and children. However, right at the last minute, the past returns to threaten this promise of happiness and domestic bliss once and for all. “All I desire” is classic melodrama: emotion and desire fills every scene. Douglas Sirk, with producer Ross Hunter, continues in this film his reputation as the master of ‘50s melodrama: expressive use of camera, lighting and performance; total devotion to pangs of the heart and soul, gender and desire, performance and identity and the limits of social convention. At the centre of “All I desire”, however, is Stanwyck’s performance, which shifts from hardened working girl to graceful lady to soft, dear-hearted mother with natural ease. It is a performance that knocks a punch into this film’s underlying theme: the bittersweet notion that in life we often learn things the hard way.

results.title: Alice: a fight for life
results.brief_description: A comprehensive investigation into one of today’s greatest health hazards - asbestos. Focuses on 47 year old Alice Jefferson’s fight for her rights and her life. She has mesothelioma’ a fatal asbestos-related disease. She contracted mesothelioma through working in a West Yorkshire factory 30 years ago.

results.title: Alice through the lift door: the other side of shopping
results.brief_description: A brief history of the various types of stores in Australia from the early market days to the present day large department store and shopping centre complexes. The behind the scenes operations of a department store are described.

results.title: Alice in wonderland [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Animated version of Lewis Carroll’s famous story about the delightful Alice who goes on a dream fantasy adventure where animals are like humans and everything is nonsense. Voices provided by Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn and Stirling Holloway.

results.title: Alice Elliot
results.brief_description: The Promo Indians are among the world’s finest basket-makers. Alice Elliot is one of a few Promo continuing this centuries-old tradition.

results.title: Alice
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, Peter-Christian Fueter, Condor Features, Film Four International and Hessischer Rundfunk
results.brief_description: In a wonderland populated by an array of superbly animated puppets, steaks crawl, rolls sprout nails and Alice (the only human in the film), not only shrinks, but becomes her own doll. Czech surrealist Jan Svankmajer’s definitive version of “Alice’s adventures in Wonderland” is a distinctive vision which remains true to the absurd and menacing spirit of Lewis Carroll’s work.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy and Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: Alfonzo: a long way from home
results.creator_credit: Gustavo Nieto Roa and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Alfonzo is a weaver in the Ecuadorian community of Otavalo. The Otavalo weavers are threatened by the competition of mass produced garments made on industrial looms. The film follows Alfonzo to Quito, where he seeks to sell his work and that of his fellows. Finally a man comes to town who claims to know how to put Otavalo’s cottage industry back into competition. Narrated by Ben Park.
